thread.title: 'Back to the Future' Day: How to Celebrate
thread.title_full: 'Back to the Future' Day: How to Celebrate

title: 'Back to the Future' Day: How to Celebrate
text: Close Embed this video <script type="text/javascript" charset="UTF-8" src="http://www.necn.com/portableplayer/?cmsID=334317061&videoID=IVc4JPnujcMj&origin=necn.com&sec=entertainment&subsec=entertainment-news&width=600&height=360"></script> More videos (1 of 9) « » Marty discovers the future is not quite like the past in "Back to the Future Part II" (Published Monday, Oct. 19, 2015) In "Back to the Future Part II," Marty McFly and Doc Brown travel to the future, all the way to Oct. 21, 2015. We don't have flying cars, but that doesn't mean we can't have a good time by celebrating what has become known as "Back to the Future" Day. You can watch all three "Back to the Future" movies for free on Amazon Prime through October. Universal also recently released a 30th anniversary Blu-ray set and the movies are playing in many cities across the country. 'Back to the Future Part II': Then Is Now Just like in the movie, the Chicago Cubs baseball team is in the playoffs and will be playing at Wrigley Field the same day Marty travels to the future. Now the team is facing off against the Mets in a series that will determine who moves on to the World Series. Superfans can also watch a documentary about the film called "Back in Time," featuring interviews with Michael J. Fox, Robert Zemeckis and Steven Spielberg. The movie will be released digitally Oct. 21.
